alert.note: Alert for Santa Barbara County Central Coast Beaches; Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 24 at 9:47AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Santa Barbara County through 1030 AM PST... At 946 AM PST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout along a line extending from 14 miles west of Vandenberg Air Force Base to 27 miles west of Point Conception. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lompoc... and Vandenberg Air Force Base. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
